events.name: Android for Tablets | NFC | Code-lab | ADK competition (June 2011 Meeting)
events.description:
Speakers :

1. Tony Chan (Google) will speak about developing apps for Android tablets.

2. Hank Droid will present NFC - a technical overview, how Android does it and potential applications. A Nexus S demo will show tag reading and peer-to-peer communication.

Code-lab : Learn how to build a tablet optimized application. Bring your laptop (and tablet if you have one) with the Android developer tools ready to go. 

Audience : Android Developers with preference for those already developed an Android app and deployed it in Android Market

Win an Android Open Accessory Development Kit (ADK) - pitch the best idea for a project that uses the ADK and the audience will vote. Winner announced at the end of the night.

RSVP: We will be giving preference to developers that have already published an application in the market if we are over-subscribed.
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the building on the ground floor and take the elevator to level 5, turn left and look for the signs.

events.name: August Sydney GTUG Meeting - Its all Go (lang) !
events.description:
Whether you have a interest or a passion for the language, tonight its all Go with two talks from Google. 
Speakers :
1.  Andrew Gerrand (Google)  - Update on the Go project with  a walk- through of the construction of a simple App Engine app.
2.  Rob Pike (Google) - In-depth  walk-through of a particularly interesting piece of Go  code, the lexer from the new template package.
What is Go ? Check out  http://golang.org/

events.name: September Sydney GTUG Meeting - AppEngine / Member Tech-Talks
events.description:
Come along to our September meeting - all welcome.

Member Tech-Talks  - Short talks from members about their recent experiences with Google technologies.

        Jon Denly                              GWT development         Adam Horvath             Chrome extensions         George Phillip             Google API to create deals geo location and geo social deals         Huy Zing                     Google+'s underlying DOM and how to hack it.              Creator of one of the first G+ extensions
      ... more to come
Please RSVP so we can cater for chairs and snacks.

events.name: October Sydney GTUG - Android : Technical + War Stories + Newness
events.description:
Its Android month again and we have some great local speakers covering both technical and business topics.

Speakers :

 

Ankur Kotwal (Google) - Whats new in Android
  Mike Boyd / Gianpaolo De Biase (AppCast) - Mike will share some "war stories" during a large Android/iOS project for a wagering company. Gianpaolo [Technical] will dive into some technical solutions for database storage and syncing.
  John Scott (StudyLink) - [Technical] MotoDev Studio 3.0 has just been released and now has  support for view code generation and great Sqlite development tools. It has saved me lots of time and hassle writing boilerplate code and I will demonstrate how.

events.name: GDD Pre-Event Dinner / Social Meetup
events.description:
Come along on for drinks and/or dinner and a chat with other GDD attendees the night before the event. There will be some Googlers present as well as community leaders from the Sydney GTUG and Android Australia User Group.

You will need to buy your own food / drink. All welcome. Hope you can make it.

What is GDD ?

Google Developer Day is a one-day event featuring advanced technical content on Google platforms and products from the teams that work on them.
Join us for the latest developments in Android, Chrome, HTML5, Cloud and more in Sydney on November 8, 2011.
http://www.google.com/events/developerday/2011/sydney/

events.name: November Sydney GTUG - Christmas Hackathon
events.description:
Our last Sydney GTUG for 2011 will mix up hackathon and an end-of-year party. Think - Nerd Office Christmas Party !

!!!! NOTE THE LATER START TIME !!!!

When : 6:45pm

There will be an EASY and FUN hackathon project for :

* AppEngine

* Android

So bring your computer and enjoy the learning and the cheer.

We have invited Santa so hopefully he can make it.

Hope you can too.

PS : Reflecting on 2011 - what is the best & coolest thing in technology you did / saw / learnt this year ? Have a think about that and we will be inviting everyone for 5-10 minute talks.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Picture Credit

events.name: Dart (not the Goggomobil ) and the APIs of Blogger
events.description:
An evening to understand and play with Dart and the APIs of Blogger

Speaker : Brett Morgan - Google

 

Q. Will it be hands on ?

A. Yep (so bring your laptop).

 

Q. Its March - what took you guys so long ?

A. Gary and Johno have both got new jobs and have been very busy in their respective transitions.

 

Q. What is a Goggomobil ? Is it Google's self-driving car ?

A. No way - but if you enjoy some uniquely Australian trivia :

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fk6pO7eLeiM

events.name: MapReduce - When to use it, when to avoid it.
events.description:
May Sydney GTUG - MapReduce

Update : A code-lab will follow the talk so if you want some hands-on then bring your laptop prep'd as described below.

Speaker : Adam Horvath

If you have heard of MapReduce and wondered what it is or how you can use it then come along and hear about Adam's experience.

You will hear about :

What is MapReduce ? What is it good for, when to avoid ? Some real world examples (with code demos) to show how easy it is to process the data you already have (log parsing, trend analysis, product recommendation based on user visits, etc). The whole idea is to show how short the learning curve can be and how easy it is to go to production with your custom data processing. CODE LAB

We are planning to have a hands-on lab after the presentation. If you want to get your hands dirty, please download and install the following free tools before the presentation:


 On Windows Microsoft.NET framework, Visual Studio or the free Visual Studio Express C# (http://www.microsoft.com/visualstudio/en-us/products/2010-editions/visual-csharp-express)
On other systems Mono framework SDK (http://www.go-mono.com/mono-downloads/download.html) MonoDevelop or your favourite source code editor tool (http://monodevelop.com/Download)

events.name: Google IO Extended - Live keynote and breakfast @ Fishburners
events.description:

events.name: July Meetup - Android News from Google I/O
events.description:
Come along and hear whats new in Android following announcements at Google I/O.

events.name: October GDG Sydney - The Google Cloud Platform: Build Apps - Not Infrastructure
events.description:
A number of the Google Cloud Platform developer relations team members are converging in Sydney t, and while they are here, they thought it would be great to have a "Cloud" GDG. They'll talk about the latest developments with App Engine, Compute Engine, Cloud Storage, and BigQuery; and how these technologies can work together for you so that you can focus on building the important stuff quickly.

There will be time for discussion and feedback.

Food and drink will be provided.

Speaker Details :

 

Crunching Big Data with Google BigQuery

Applications which grow to web-scale generate massive amounts of data.  Many developers end up throwing this data away because they can’t extract value from it without the necessary expertise or infrastructure.

Google knows Big Data --  our infrastructure processes 60 hours of YouTube video uploads every minute and many of our products have hundreds of millions of users. Google has developed custom technologies to analyze this data and make intelligent product decisions.  We’ve started to open up some of these technologies as APIs which allow developers to concentrate on their business problems, while Google handles the underlying infrastructure.

Google BigQuery is a Big Data analysis tool born from an internal technology known as Dremel. BigQuery enables developers to analyze terabyte data sets in seconds using a RESTful API and a SQL-like query language. We'll demonstrate how you can incorporate Google BigQuery into your own applications, and how queries are processed underneath the covers.  We’ll also show examples using public data sets and demos built by other developers like you.

Speaker Bios:

Ryan Boyd is a Developer Advocate at Google, focused on cloud data services such as Google BigQuery. He’s been in the Developer Relations group for 6 years and previously helped build out the Google Apps ISV ecosystem. Ryan recently published his first book on “Getting Started with OAuth 2.0” with O’Reilly.

Michael Manoochehriis a Google Engineer supporting developers who work with Google's Cloud and Data platforms. With many years of experience working for research and non-profit organizations, he is interested in making data analysis on large scale computing infrastructure more accessible and affordable.

--------

GCE & GCS: Batch processing on demand

We live in an age of inexpensive, powerful computing resources. Taking advantage of them no longer means sacrificing space or dedicating hours to maintenance. You can offload more and more of your batch computing workload to the cloud, and the newly announced Google Compute Engine offers scalable workload processing.

This talk will describe how you can leverage Google’s computing infrastructure, which daily manages vast quantities of distributed data, at global scale, with sub-second response time, under extremely heavy load. Google Compute Engine is making this powerful infrastructure available to everyone. We’ll talk about how you can make the intersection between Google Cloud Storage and Google Compute Engine work for you and your business. We will show some live demonstrations that illustrate how using these powerful technologies can simplify and expedite your batch processing jobs.

Speaker Bio:

Julia Ferraioli is a Developer Advocate working with Google Compute Engine. She comes from an industrial background as a software engineer, where she worked the backend processing for a collaboration service, and an academic background in machine learning and assistive technology. Her interests lie in harnessing the power of computing to improve the quality of peoples’ lives.

--------

Google App Engine: Build Apps, Not Infrastructure

Google App Engine is a cloud development platform that makes it easy to write robust web applications, simple to scale them to a global audience, and straightforward to manage them over time.

This talk will give an overview of App Engine, with a focus on some of its newer features, such as Full-Text Search, traffic splitting, Page Speed, and backend instances.  We'll include a short demonstration that shows how easy it is to get an App Engine app deployed and running.

Speaker Bio:

Amy Unruh is a Developer Programs Engineer at Google, working with App Engine.  She has an academic background, and has also worked at several startups, worked in industrial R&D, done technical training and course development, and has published a book with Packt Publishing on "Google App Engine Java and GWT Application Development".

events.name: December GDG Sydney - Google App Engine - What's New
events.description:
Following on from our popular October event on Cloud technologies is a talk on Google App Engine.

Speaker - Amy Unruh (Google)

Google App Engine is a cloud development platform that makes it easy to write robust web applications, simple to scale them to a global audience, and straightforward to manage them over time.

This talk will give an overview of App Engine, with a focus on some of its newer features, such as Full-Text Search; the Sockets API, which provides outbound socket support (currently in the Trusted Tester phase); Cloud Endpoints, which supports APIs for mobile and web backends (also in Trusted Tester); and traffic splitting, which enables easy A/B testing. The talk will include a look at some code, and a demonstration of some of these features.

Speaker Bio: Amy Unruh is a Developer Programs Engineer at Google, working with App Engine. She has an academic background, and has also worked at several startups, worked in industrial R&D, done technical training and course development, and has published a book with Packt Publishing on "Google App Engine Java and GWT Application Development".

events.name: April GDG Sydney - Google Cloud Endpoints
events.description:
Google Cloud Endpoints is a collection of tools, libraries and capabilities, that allow you to generate Endpoints and client libraries from a Google App Engine backend to simplify client access to that web app. Endpoints makes it easy to create a web backend for mobile clients such as Android or Apple's iOS.Cloud Endpoints are supported for both the Java and Python App Engine runtimes.

This talk will introduce Endpoints, show how to define the backend APIs on App Engine, and show how to access those APIs from various clients.  We'll show how to use Google's Discovery Service to access the APIs from a python client script, as well as how to build mobile client libraries using Java and Eclipse.

Speaker : Amy Unruh - Google Sydney

2nd Talk : We have a 2nd speaker tonight from Google talking about using the Google+ Sign-In API.

Snacks and Refreshments will be provided.

events.name: Google APIs : Drive Realtime and Android Maps v2
events.description:
Two very interesting APIs for Developers from Google.

1ST TALK: Introduction to the Google Drive Realtime API

Just a few weeks old, the latest addition to the Google Drive SDK enables developers build apps with Google Docs-like realtime collaborative editing features without worrying about servers or scaling. Come learn more about the API, how it works, and how to get started building your own app on the API.

Speaker: Steven Bazyl (Google)

Steve is Developer Advocate at Google focused on developers integrating with Google Drive. Prior to Google he worked at IGT in their interactive gaming division, and at RSA Security where he worked on enterprise authentication & authorization systems. When not working, he enjoys playing games of all kinds, traveling, and spending time with his wife Jessica and their 3 cats.

------------------------------

2ND TALK : Google Maps API for Android v2
Speaker : Jan-Felix Schmakeit (Google)

Snacks and Refreshments will be provided.

events.name: Games on Google Event
events.description:
Games on Google event

When: Tuesday, 14th May

Time: 2.00pm-5.30pm
Where: Googleplex - Level 5, 48 Pirrama Road, Pyrmont, Sydney, NSW 2009

Google Cloud Platform provides everything you need to build, run, and scale social, mobile, and online games. Already, tens of thousands of popular applications like SongPop, Angry Birds, SnapChat, and Legend of Monsters are benefiting from the power of running on top of Google Infrastructure. Come join Google as we go deep on how to best leverage our technology to build your next masterpiece. This event will use actual code walkthroughs to allow developers to understand exactly how to easily create online and mobile games. See just how simple it can be to get started, see real code, and don't forget to sign up for free at cloud.google.com.

Please RSVP at :

http://lp.google-mkto.com/google-gamingevent-syd.html

events.name: 2 Android talks : Whats new & important | NFC bring apps to the physical world
events.description:
A double-dose of Android goodness tonight.

1st Speaker : Ankur Kotwal (Google) - Whats new and important in Android.

2nd Speaker : Darren Younger (tapnshow) - Using Near Field Communication (NFC) to bring your apps into the physical world.

NFC is an emerging technology allowing smartphones to interact with real-world objects and is yet to be harnassed by app developers. So far the playing feild for NFC is dominated by payment processing merchants, but that is only the beginning!

Learn how businesses are starting to use NFC and the results they are acheiving.

Recent case studies include Canon, Samsung and Telstra.

 

Refreshments provided.

events.name: Big Query and App Engine
events.description:
Some cloud - action for you this month with two interesting talks :

Speaker 1 - Vish Agashe (Big Data Lead, Google) - Vish is visiting Sydney and we are fortunate to be able to get him to speak about Google Big Query and how customers are using it to solve interesting Big Data problems.

Speaker 2 - Jerome Mouton (SnapEngage, Germany) - Super-charge your startup with Google AppEngine. Jerome is visiting Sydney too (he also organises GDG Berlin) and has a talk for startups about why Google AppEngine is the perfect platform for a web startup.

Refreshments provided by Google.

events.name: html5 - Polymer Project : Web Components of tomorrow, available today
events.description:
Time for some update y'all on what is hot at the moment in html5 development.

Speaker : Alex Danilo (Google) - About the Polymer Project and where it at since Google I/O. Web Components are all about creating your own elements like and or whatever you can imagine. Polymer is a JavaScript library that enables WebComponents now in modern web browsers as we wait for them to be implemented natively.

AngularJS has similar concepts so you may be wondering where it overlaps with Polymer. Come and find out.

Snacks and refreshements supplied by Google (thanks !)

events.name: Android Hackathon - for Beginners and the Experienced
events.description:
How does a whole day learning and hacking on Maps for Android sound ?

As part of http://www.startupspring2013.org/ we are hosting an Android Hackathon at Google Sydney.

For Beginners - talks and code-labs will guide you to a working Android app using the native Maps v2 API. How good is that !?!

For Experienced Android Devs - a good chance to focus on the native Android v2 API and get something working in 24 hrs.

Fri 4 Oct - 6pm - 10pm
- Talk : Google Maps for Android (Jan Felix Schmakeit - Google)
- Group and Project formation
- Go home and sleep

Sat 5 Oct - 10am - 6pm
- Beginners Track : Start with an Android Maps Code Lab and then join a group and hack away for the rest of the day.
- Experienced Track : Hack away on your chosen project.
- End of day showcase and prizes.

events.name: GDG Sydney : Android Beautiful Design + CommBank's `Albert`payment terminals
events.description:
Two great talks on Android :

Speaker 1 : Ankur Kotwal (Google) : Android Design - How to make Android apps look Beautiful.

Speaker 2 : Steven Hadley from CommBank will be introducing 'Albert', a new Android based payments terminal developed by CommBank. He will be sharing with you the experiences of developing such a unique device starting with the Why? build such a device. Followed by What? it is and How? they achieved it. Lastly he will explain what this means for developers and how you can get involved in this new ecosystem. This talk gives you an interesting insight into a worlds first and will be of interest to any sort of developer/designer/architect/technologist particularly those with a mobile development or retail systems background. His session will be a 30 min talk followed by a Q&A session.

Refreshments provided by Google.

events.name: GDG - February
events.description: Michael Woodward - Tech Lead Manager for the Google Maps on Android Auto team has kindly volunteered to present Android Auto & the I/O boombox.

events.name: GDG - March: All about containers
events.description:
We will be having two talks about Docker and Kubernetes:

Alan Milligan will be giving a introduction into Docker. Docker adds some niceties to Linux containers such as AUFS, version control, docker registry (repository), versioning etc. This talk will serve as an introduction to working with docker tools. Alan will cover the basic concepts behind docker and explain the difference between a docker container and a VM. Show a demo of how easy it is to create a docker image and launch a container from it. Briefly explain the idea behind Dockerfile and show some examples and tools.

Greg Markey will then introduce us to Kubernetes, a Docker container orchestration system.

Kubernetes is an open source orchestration system for Docker containers. It handles scheduling onto nodes in a compute cluster and actively manages workloads to ensure that their state matches the users declared intentions.

events.name: Women Techmakers by GDG Sydney
events.description:

events.name: Polymer Leadership Special Event
events.description:
The US-based Polymer development team are coming to Sydney to host this one-off event. 

Join Polymer's Director of Engineering, Matt McNulty and his engineering team who are bringing their unique design insights about Polymer. They'll talk about the latest developments and provide the audience an unprecedented opportunity to interact with the core engineering team, giving you the chance to ask all those burning questions.

Hosted by GDG Sydney in conjunction with PolymerSYD

Please RSVP for this event on the PolymerSyd meetup page
https://www.meetup.com/PolymerSyd/events/238047028/

events.name: Google Cloud OnBoard
events.description:
OnBoard is a free full-day instructor-led enablement and training event that will provide you with a step-by-step technical introduction to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). Through a combination of instructor-led presentations and technical demonstrations, you will learn how to get started with Google App Engine, Datastore, Storage, Container Engine, Compute Engine and Network, Big Data and Machine Learning. 

OnBoard has been designed for IT Managers, Systems Engineers and Operations professionals, Developers, Solution Architects and modern business leaders who are exploring cloud solutions or are new to Google Cloud Platform. Leveraging the GCP Fundamentals course, the event will provide you with the technical training you need to get started as well as access to tips and tricks, industry best-practice and questions and answers from the GCP team.

Please register for this event at the link below. This event is also being held in Melbourne on March 30th.

https://cloudplatformonline.com/gcp-au-googlecloudonboard.html

events.name: Google I/O 2017 Extended
events.description:
Google I/O Extended

If you couldn't attend Google I/O 2017 in person, and you haven't had a chance to watch all the content on YouTube, come along and see what's new with Google!

events.name: GCP Australia Region Launch
events.description:
Australia's Google Cloud Platform region has arrived!

In conjunction with this launch, we will be discussing interesting GCP features in our upcoming meetup. Hear anything and everything GCP, from what it means to be "serverless" to bike share data analysis.

To make the most use of your time, come with questions, mingle, and interact with our speakers from all around the globe! Limited seats are available so RSVP now! 

• IMPORTANT: RSVPs will close one week before the event to ensure Google security has enough time for their internal processes to kick in. In line with this, please make sure that you have your FIRST NAME and LAST NAME indicated correctly in your meetup.com profile. Do not forget to bring your ticket/email confirmation on the day of!

See you there!

We will be hearing from:

Mete Atamel (Apache Beam and Google Cloud Dataflow) - In this session, we will take a look at the history of massive-scale data processing at Google and how it has evolved over the years. We will learn about Apache Beam, an open source programming model unifying batch and stream processing and see how Apache Beam pipelines can be executed in Google Cloud Dataflow, a fully-managed cloud service for batch and stream data processing.

Bret McGowen (Serverless with Google Cloud) - From Functions-as-a-Service to Backend-as-a-Service, even Big Data-as-a-Service, Serverless is taking many different shapes. Learn what these mean and how Google Cloud Platform is building technology to make sure there's nothing standing between you and running your code. You'll see live demos of integration between Firebase, Cloud Functions, Cloud Pub/Sub (and even machine learning) to build autoscaling apps in record time - all without managing servers or application runtimes.

Sara Robinson (Analysing 33 million bike trips with BigQuery) - With so many people using NYC’s bike share program, I wanted to see if I could spot any trends in usage. But how did I go from observing bikers on the street to creating visualisations of popular routes based on different biker demographics? Enter Google’s managed big data analytics warehouse tool - BigQuery! Using BigQuery, I ran queries on 33 million bike trips and integrated my findings with a few visualisation tools. I’ll explain my process, do some live queries, and show you how to do the same analysis with your own data.

Malcolm Holden (Dataproc Overview) - Overview and demo of Google Cloud Platform's Dataproc: a managed Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Pig, and Apache Hive service, to easily process big datasets at low cost.

events.name: CROSS PROMOTION - Messaging Platforms & the Future of Work
events.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON THE EVENTBRITE PAGE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/messaging-platforms-and-the-future-of-work-tickets-39212310075

The Slack Devrel Team is in the midst of their APAC tour and GDG Sydney is happy to help them with the Sydney leg. Spend the evening with us talking about bots and messanging apps.

Again, please head on over to this Eventbrite link (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/messaging-platforms-and-the-future-of-work-tickets-39212310075) to get your tickets.

events.name: DevFest 2017: RSVP ON EVENTBRITE
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas!

We have a variety of topics this year on Android, machine learning, cloud computing, and IoT. Please check the website (http://www.devfest.org.au/) for more details.

Massive thanks to our sponsors Domain.com.au, Google Developers, JetBrains, Shine Solutions, and Actions on Google!

GET YOUR TICKETS NOW! (Do not RSVP on this page, you will need a ticket through eventbrite).

events.name: December Meetup
events.description:
Let's have one last hurrah for 2017! We will have two talks for the evening:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Building for the Google Assistant (Tom Greenaway)

Learn about building Google Assistant Apps using the Actions on Google platform and DialogFlow as well as some tips, tricks and best practices for building a great conversational experience.

Architecture Components - Use Cases (Florina Muntenescu)

The Architecture Components set of libraries help you design robust, testable, and maintainable apps. In this talk we’ll discuss what each of these libraries do, and look at the patterns and anti-patterns that you should follow. We’ll also dive into the important issue of where data should be saved to minimise requests: the database, ViewModel, or onSavedInstanceState?

Finally, we’ll discuss the Paging library, the latest addition to the Architecture Components. You’ll learn about how the Paging library works and find out why and how you should use it.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here are a few details about our speakers:

Tom Greenaway

Tom is part of the Developer Relations team working with key partners to bring the best Google technology to users everywhere. Before joining Google he ran his own independent game studio. As an expert in web, mobile game, UI and UX design he is excited to be exploring the new challenges that voice user interface design brings and discovering how to make these interfaces fun and engaging.

Florina Muntenescu

Florina is working as an Android Developer Advocate at Google, helping developers architect clean, testable apps using the Architecture Components libraries. She has been working with Android for 8 years, previous work covering news at upday, payment solutions at payleven and navigation services at Garmin.

events.name: January Meetup: Let's Talk Open Source!
events.description:
Google Open Source (https://opensource.google.com/) is in town for Linux.conf.au (http://linux.conf.au/) and partnering with GDG Sydney to host a FOSS-focused event about Google Summer of Code (https://g.co/gsoc) and Google Code-in (https://g.co/gci).

These two annual programs pair university and teenage students with mentors to contribute to open source projects.

In the 14 years since Google Open Source started running student programs, over 13,000 students from more than 108 countries have contributed 33,000,000+ lines of code to at least 608 open source projects.

Please join us for an evening of food, drink, lightning talks, and a brief presentation from the Google Open Source team's Stephanie Taylor and Josh Simmons.

All are welcome, whether you're a student, educator, project maintainer, or member of a FOSS community!

events.name: Google I/O Extended 2018
events.description:
Come join us for a drink and a bite. WooliesX has generously offered their venue and will provide us with some refreshments.

We will be watching the recorded Keynote session from Google I/O which happen the night before. Come join us to discuss and enjoy the announcements.

events.name: May Meetup: All Things New and Shiny
events.description:
Let us talk about all the new announcements from the recently concluded Google I/O! We will hear from some of our members who attended in person so make sure to come by with all your questions.

Please note that we are back in our usual haunt this month.
events.how_to_find_us: Enter the Accenture building and take the lift up to level 5

events.name: Getting Ready to Flutter
events.description:
Sydney’s first Flutter meetup!

Over the last year Flutter has seen a tremendous increase in adoption and is nearing its first stable release. Consider this an introductory session about Flutter.

Agenda:

Zarah: Welcome!

Nick: Overview of what adopting Flutter in a commercial setting feels like

Quirijn & Brett: An introduction to Flutter!

Quirijn & Brett: Announcing Flutter Study Jam and future sessions!

PLEASE NOTE that we are meeting at ONE DARLING ISLAND ROAD.
events.how_to_find_us: Proceed to One Darling Island Road (the Domain/Fairfax building), security will check you off a list then beep you in through the gates and up the lift to level 2.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Session 1
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Following our 'Getting Ready to Flutter’ meetup, we are stepping up our game and we’re starting a full-fledged series of Flutter Study Jam sessions.
These sessions are prepared by the Flutter team at Google and start off with the *very* basics of Flutter. So if you've never used Flutter before, come join in. If you have some basic knowledge, it might not be the best use of your time :)
Keep in mind that this is a hands-on session, so not many spots are available. Make sure you can attend before you RSVP so you give other people a chance.

Bring a laptop! If you want to hit the ground running, make sure you have Flutter installed on your laptop prior to starting the Study Jam. Windows/Linux/Mac are all fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

This is Session 1 of 3 and each session builds on the previous
Session 2: https://www.meetup.com/gdgsydney/events/254578726/
Session 3: https://www.meetup.com/gdgsydney/events/254578753/

Agenda:

Zarah: Welcome!

Quirijn & Brett: Kicking off the Flutter Study jam

Break

Quirijn & Brett: More Flutter!

Thank you's, hugs and goodbye's
events.how_to_find_us: Proceed to One Darling Island Road (the Domain/Fairfax building), security will check you off a list then beep you in through the gates and up the lift to level 2.

events.name: TensorFlow & DeepMind @ Fishburners
events.description:
Join Google AI (https://ai.google/) and DeepMind (https://deepmind.com/) at Fishburners as we explore and discuss recent developments and initiatives in machine learning.

Hear from Research leads on TensorFlow’s ecosystem offerings (including TensorFlow Extended (https://www.tensorflow.org/tfx/) and TensorFlow Hub(https://www.tensorflow.org/hub/) ) and DeepMind on their use of Machine Learning to improve Pixel battery life.

AGENDA
6:00 pm - Food, Drinks, and Networking
6:30 pm - Lightning Talks
Clemens Mewald, TensorFlow Extended
Anna Ukhanova, TensorFlow Hub
Alex Davies, DeepMind
7:10 pm - Q&A and more Networking

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS:
Clemens Mewald
Product Manager, Google AI

Clemens is the product lead for TensorFlow Extended (TFX), an end-to-end ML platform based on TensorFlow, and several other TensorFlow products. Clemens holds an MSc in Computer Science from UAS Wiener Neustadt (Austria) and an MBA from MIT Sloan.

Anna Ukhanova
Technical Program Manager, Google AI

Anna is a research lead in Google AI Europe, focusing on a wide array of ML and AI topics. Anna received a M.Sc. in Information and Communication Systems from St. Petersburg State University of Aerospace Instrumentation in Russia, and a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU). She is a grantee of the Danish National Advanced Technology Foundation for research work in the field of visual perception. She has been working with Google Switzerland since 2014.

Alex Davies
Software Engineer, DeepMind

Alex is a research engineer in the DeepMind Applied team in London. Prior to this he was one of the leads in the Applied ML team at Google. He received his PhD from the Machine Learning Group at the University of Cambridge working with Zoubin Ghahramani researching the effective implementation of Gaussian Processes and has appeared on the BBC as an emoticon expert.

Tim Davis
Product Manager, Google AI

Tim is the product lead for TensorFlow Lite, deploying machine learning on Mobile and Embedded Systems, in addition to overall TensorFlow strategy. Tim has a background in Engineering, Finance, Law and Computer Science as well as being a 2x company founder and entrepreneur in Silicon Valley. Twitter @iamtimdavis

Eddie Zhou
Software Engineer, Google AI

Eddie is a ML engineer on Google Brain working to apply and drive research and ML through the form of deep collaborations with a wide range of products.

events.name: OK Google, teach me how to build Actions
events.description:
Building Actions on Google

Developers can build Actions that do things beyond our wildest imaginations. From mobile to voice, developers have been thinking about the use cases that will delight Google Assistant users.
In this event, Mandy will share the unique features that the Actions on Google platform brings to the table and how it allows developers to unlock and utilise their creativity. She will explore the potential of using voice by demoing some examples with everyone, and then dive into how you can create the next fun and useful Action yourself!

Pre-requirements
Know at least one programming language
Check out Codelab Level 1 - http://bit.ly/aog-codelab-1
Find Mandy on her Twitter (@mandychannyc), feel free to say hi to her before March 25th

Agenda:
6-6:30pm - Food + Networking
6:30-7pm - Presentation
7-8:30pm - Workshop
events.how_to_find_us: Register at building reception on groundfloor. We'll be in Cylon

events.name: I/O Extended 2019
events.description:
Welcome to I/O Extended 2019! Join us for some livestream content of the Google I/O conference at the WooliesX office in Surry Hills.

We will have some pizza and drinks.

We have applied some heavy machine learning and sentiment analysis on your RSVP's and the machines have determined the most requested session is the developer keynote!

Join the conversation at #io19extended
events.how_to_find_us: We will be at the Ground Floor. Please try to be on time, if you arrive after 6.30pm please use the phone number on the door.

events.name: International Flutter Hackathon #Hack19
events.description:
Join us in a full day of hacking together using Flutter. Work with a team of 2 to 4 people, to build fun, unusual, interesting, or helpful projects which could go on to change the world! This is the perfect opportunity to work on all those great ideas you've been coming up with 😉

This hackathon is part of an international event organised by the Flutter community, so expect some fierce competition! To make voting easier we're providing a theme which we will share with everyone on the day of the event (so nobody gets a head start). We will also provide a list of suggested features and technologies to help guide development. Participants will still have lots of freedom and flexibility when building their project.

To hit the ground running please install Flutter before that event. Find out how on https://flutterhackathon.com/#getting-started

To foster collaboration and learning, we won't be allowing solo developers. We'll help you find a team!

At the end of the day we will vote for the best project, The winning project is then submitted to the international vote. International votes are due by end of day Sunday, June 2 (UTC). The top 3 winners will be announced afterwards and will receive a beautiful custom trophy.

Schedule (subject to change):
10:00am - Kickoff / team forming
11:00am - Ideation
12:00am - Lunch / more coding
4:30pm - Upload code / videos
5:00pm - Presentations / voting
6:00pm - Wrap-up

Lunch will be provided, as well as snacks and drinks throughout the day

We'll provide more details of the event as we get closer to the date but check out https://flutterhackathon.com for general event details.
events.how_to_find_us: Go to reception to sign in and someone will let you up!

events.name: The News According to I/O
events.description:
Lots of things were announced and released during I/O, and we will try to distill them all in bite-sized pieces tonight.

We are very privileged to host Nicole, a visiting DevRel engineer from Mountain View tonight.

What's New in Jetpack? (Nicole Borrelli)

What's New in Flutter? (Brett Morgan, Quirijn Groot Bluemink)
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the Fairfax building and sign in with security at the lobby. Someone will be there to let you in and bring you up to Cylon.

events.name: Google AUNZ App Summit 2019
events.description:
*** THIS EVENT HAS REACHED CAPACITY ***

Google AdMob organises an event for mobile app businesses (gaming studios, utility, food&drink, productivity, entertainment, finance apps...), helping them in their journey thanks to ad monetisation and analytics!

You'll find the detailed agenda here: https://events.withgoogle.com/app-summit-aunz-19/#content

events.name: Flutter meetup - August
events.description:
Thanks to Google for our venue, pizzas and drinks.

Doors open at 6pm, and we'll start talks at 6.30pm:

This meetup we welcome 2 community members to talk about their experience with Flutter

*Agenda*

Hybrid Apps: one for all, all for Flutter (Mitchell Tilbrook)
====================================
When you need to integrate with an SDK using activities/ViewControllers, make a hybrid app, or just make a platform plugin how can you safely pass data between Flutter and Platform code? To solve this comms issue we will look at using Protobuff over Method Channels to safely pass data between all mobile platforms.

MobX programming (Michael Bui)
====================================
Flutter’s approach to doing UI has led to a lot of developers wondering how they should be managing state. In this talk, we’ll be seeing going through the concepts behind MobX and see how it can be used to do manage UI state in a way that should hopefully feel familiar to those coming from other ecosystems

Join us on slack!
http://bit.ly/gdg-sydney
events.how_to_find_us: Go to the Fairfax building and sign in with security at the lobby. Someone will be there to let you in and bring you up to Cylon.

group_profile.intro: Seasoned Android dev new in Sydney.
